ezRNAseq
  • Reference

StepProfiler: Extract temporally Up- and Down- regulated genes using DESeq2.

stepProfiler can be used to identify four temporal gene expression patterns that we refer to as one-step-up, one-step-down, impulsed-up, impulsed-down.

  • pairewise_compare(): paire-wise comparison between all groups.
  • one_step_up(): Low before a step i and increase gradually, at step i+1, during all the next transition steps.
  • one_step_down(): High before a step i and decrease gradually, from step i+1, during all the next transition steps.
  • one_step_up_sustained(): Low before a step i, upregulated, from step i+1, and remain stable during all the next transition steps: the maximum fold change between the step i+1 and the following steps must be in [-1.4, 1.4] (stability fold change).
  • one_step_down_sustained(): Highly expressed before step i, downregulated at step i+1 and remain stable during all the next transition steps: the maximum fold change between the current step and the next step must be in [-1.4, 1.4].
  • impulses_up(): upregulated gradually and significantly during all the previous transitions (i--) until the current step i, then decrease significantly and gradually during all the next transition steps. There is an impulse signal at step i with a minimum fc = 1.5. This expression profile is also called as two-step-down-up.
  • impulse_up_sustained(): Low and stable during the previous and the next transitions, significant impulse at step i with a minimum fc = 1.5.
  • impulse_down(): downregulated significantly and gradually during all the previous transitions (i--) until the current step i, then increase significantly and gradually during all the next transition steps. There is an impulse signal at step i with a minimum fc = 1.5. This expression profile is also called as two-step-down-up.
  • impulse_down_sustained(): High and stable during the previous and the next transitions, significant impulse at step i with a minimum fc = 1.5.
  • plot(): Draw step genes using ggplot2 

pairewise_compare(dds, factor, grps, alpha = 0.05, fc = 1,
  active_exprs = 1, count.norm = NULL, exprs.norm = NULL,
  verbose = TRUE, ...)

one_step_up(pwc, fc = 1.5, verbose = TRUE)

one_step_down(pwc, fc = 1.5, verbose = TRUE)

impulsed_up(pwc, fc = 1.5, verbose = TRUE)

impulsed_down(pwc, fc = 1.5, verbose = TRUE)

# S3 method for stepgenes
plot(x, transformby = c("firststep", "basemean",
  "standardize", "none"), size = c(0.2, 1), getRegFunc = NULL,
  print_plot = TRUE, ...)

# S3 method for stepgenes
summary(object, ...)

pathways(object, gn_id_type = "ENSEMBL", pvalueCutoff = 0.05,
  OrgDb = "org.Hs.eg.db", verbose = TRUE)

Arguments

dds
an object of class DESeqDataSet containing the diff_exprs of the function DESeq().
factor
the name of a factor in the design formula (e.g factor = "group")
grps
a vector containing at list 2 groups to be compared.
alpha
false discovery rate
fc
positive value specifying fold change threshold. Must be at least 1. Genes with fc > 1 are kept.
active_exprs
a numeric value specifying detected expression cutoff. If not NULL, any gene with an average expression above this cutoff, in at least one group, is declared as actively expressed. Used for defining presence and absence detection call. If not NULL, a column named detection_call is added to the result. Possible values for detection_call is 0 (the gene is not actively expressed) or 1 (the gene is actively expressed).
count.norm
a data frame containing the normalized count as provided by DESeq2. Only used for computing the detection call when active_expression is not NULL.
exprs.norm
a data frame containing the normalized gene expression data. An alias of count.norm.
verbose
logical value; if TRUE the progression is shown.
...
other arguments
pwc
an object of class "pairewise_compare" as returned by the function pairewise_compare().
x
an object of class step_genes to be plotted
transformby
a character vector specifying how to transform the expression signal before plotting. Possible values are:
  • standardize: the rlog data is standardized, before plotting, using the function scale().
  • firstep: the log2 fold change expression compared to the first group is displayed
  • none: the mean rlog expression is displayed
size
a numeric vector of length 2 containing the size of lines and points, respectively.
getRegFunc
a function for identifying regulators (transcription factor/epigenetic enzymes) in a list of genes. A possible value is get_human_regulators.
print_plot
a logical value used in the function plot.stepgenes(). If TRUE ggplots are printed. If FALSE, a list, which elements are ggplots, is returned instead of being printed.
object
an object of class step_genes to be plotted
gn_id_type
the type of gene ids. Allowed values are "ENSEMBL" "ENTREZID", "SYMBOL", "UNIGENE", "GENENAME" or "UCSCKG".
pvalueCutoff
Cutoff value of pvalue
OrgDb
annotation database. Default is "org.Hs.eg.db" for human.

Value

pairewise_compare() returns a list containing the following elements:

  • significance: a data frame containing the pairewise comparison results. Each column corresponds to the significance of a given comparison. Rows are genes wich can have -1, 0 or 1 values for each column. -1 = significantly downregulated; 0 = not significant; 1 = significantly upregulated. A significant deregulated gene is a gene with active expression AND padj < = alpha AND absolute fold change >= fc.
  • foldchanges: a data frame containing log2 fold changes from the different comparisons.
  • padj: a data frame containing the adjusted p-values from the different comparisons.
  • groups: the differents groups used for the pairewise comparisons. This corresponds to levels(samples$group).
  • steps: transition steps from group_i to group_i+1
  • nstep: the number of steps
  • steps_mean_fc: a numeric vector containing the mean of the absolute fold change during transitions. Can be useful for sorting genes.
  • dds: the dds used during pairewise comparison.
  • count.norm: the normalized count as provided by DESeq2
  • rlog.data: 'regularized log' transformed data as provided by DESeq2
  • samples: samples data as provided by colData(dds)
  • refs: a numeric vector containing the mean normalized expression of each gene in the first group. This is used when plotting the results with argument transformby = "firstgroup" in order to display the log2 fold change expression in the other groups compared to the first group as reference samples.
  • detection_call a vector containing 1 or 0 specifying whether the gene is actively expressed or not in at least one group. This computed according to the value of the argument active_exprs.
  • steps_mean_fc the mean of the absolute fold change during transitions. Can be useful for sorting genes.
  • baseMean the mean normalized count for all samples.

one_step_*(), impulsed_*() returns an object of class stepgenes which is a list of sub-lists. Each sub-list corresponds to a given step and contains the following elements:

  • exprs: a data frame containing the normalized gene expression values. Columns are samples and rows are genes.
  • foldchanges, padj, refs, baseMean: see the description above.
  • group: a factor containing the group assignment of samples

Genes are ordered according to the mean fold change expression during all transitions, so that the most relevant genes are shown at the top the data table.

plot(): Plots step genes using ggplot2.

summary(): Returns a data frame which columns are:

  • id: gene IDs
  • status: the expression status of a gene at a given step
  • step: the step at which the expression status changes
  • group: Numeric coding of the step column
  • max_fcs and min_fcs: the maximum and the minimum fold change expression at each transition, respectively.

Contents

  • Value
